verse:
महतः परमव्यक्तमव्यक्तात्पुरुषः परः।
पुरुषान्न परं किंचित्सा काष्ठा सा परा गतिः ॥

terms.महतः (mahatah): From the great, from the supreme

meaning: Meaning:From the great, from the supreme, from the unmanifested, the individual self is superior. There is nothing beyond the individual self. That individual self is like a log of wood, and beyond it lies the ultimate goal or destination.

upanishad-org.meaning: And higher than the Great-Self is the Unmanifest and higher than the Unmanifest is the Purusha: than the Purusha there is none higher: He is the culmination. He is the highest goal of the journey.
